data.event: The site is marked by several monuments including the Museum of Australian Democracy at Eureka (M.A.D.E), which opened in May 2013 and houses the symbolic Eureka Flag, on loan from the Art Gallery of Ballarat.
Civil disobedience in Eureka led to Australia's first and only armed civil uprising, the Eureka Rebellion (colloquially referred to as the Eureka Stockade) which took place on 3 December 1854.
